sentences.english: It must be strong, solid, but not coarse.
sentences.chinese: 他必须要是坚实有力的，但也不能粗陋。

sentences.english: This is a crudely built house.
Come to the humble hall in which we meet.
sentences.chinese: 到我们聚会的那个粗陋的厅堂里去。

sentences.english: It inculcated universal asceticism and social levelling in its crudest form.
sentences.chinese: 这种文献倡导普遍的禁欲主义和粗陋的平均主义。

sentences.english: The young, the all-beautiful Ione, is seated by that rude fire.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的绝代美人伊俄涅坐在粗陋的火炉旁。

sentences.english: Its speech, however, consists entirely of rude phrases and insults .
sentences.chinese: 可惜它的语言全是粗陋和侮辱性的言辞。

sentences.english: My children call it at a one-horse town.
sentences.chinese: 自己地孩子们叫它在一个设备粗陋城镇。

sentences.english: Bug reports and feature requests will get closed with rude remarks.
sentences.chinese: Bug报告和特性要求将伴以粗陋的评论而被关闭掉。

sentences.english: I’m not just talking about grid systems and earthy screen designs.
sentences.chinese: 我并不只是在谈论网格系统和粗陋的屏幕设计。

sentences.english: The crudest form of millennialism forecasts great material prosperity on earth.
sentences.chinese: 最粗陋的千禧年主义者预言会有极大的物质丰富。

sentences.english: They stayed one day and one night in the farmhouse of a very humble farm.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一家非常粗陋的农场的农舍中呆了一天一夜。

sentences.english: He seemed unaware that his coarseness might cause others to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎不知道自己的粗陋不雅会叫别人难堪。

definition: more than one would wish/somewhat/a bit too (old, contrived, distracting etc)
variant of 寒磣|寒碜[han2 chen5]
